page.title: 07CHANGING TIMES
page.content:
In the year 45ad there was a village on the site of Cotgrave and four Roman soldiers have been found buried here with their weapons.Godegrave was the village mentioned in the Domesday Book which was written in 1086.In 1094 the village was called Cotegrava.This name came from Cottagraefer. Cotta was the name of the lord and Graefer meant "thicket". In 1108 it was called Cotes grava;in 1158 it was called Cottegraua; in 1268 it was called Ketegrave.In 1400 it was called Codgrave and in 1684 it was called Cotgrave.
In 1637 one third of the population died of the Black Death.
In January 1603 the Rector Thomas Hunt was cross with the bell ringers and he beat them with his wooden leg.
